did.unittitle: Culinary Ephemera: Flour Products, Leavening Agents, and Baked Goods
did.abstract: Forms part of the Janice Bluestein Longone Culinary Archive. This collection includes promotional materials relating to flour (primarily wheat flour); leavening agents such as yeast, baking powder, and baking soda; and some material focused generally on baked goods. Publications date from 1864-2002, with most materials dating from after 1900.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is divided into three series, based on subject and physical organization. These series are: Series 1: Flour Products, Series 2: Leavening Agents, and Series 3: Flour, Baking Powder, and Baked Goods. Series 3 contains a mix of subjects, due to previously-established physical arrangement of the collection.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The Janice Bluestein Longone Culinary Archive (JBLCA) transferred from the William L. Clements Library in June 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Culinary Ephemera: Flour Products, Leavening Agents, and Baked Goods, University of Michigan Library (Special Collections Research Center, Janice Bluestein Longone Culinary Archive)

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials have been housed in archival plastic bags and boards within acid-free boxes. Culinary ephemera materials acquired before January 2018 were cataloged using MARC at the box level. These records were converted to EAD using an XSLT style sheet and edited together based on subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forms part of the Janice Bluestein Longone Culinary Archive. This collection includes promotional materials relating to flour (primarily wheat flour); leavening agents such as yeast, baking powder, and baking soda; and some material focused generally on baked goods. Publications date from 1864-2002, with most materials dating from after 1900.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan. Permission to publish must be obtained from the copyright holder(s).

did.unittitle: Flour Products

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 1: Flour includes publications from a range of companies promoting flour products. Most publications focus on recipes for sweet baked goods, such as cake, pie, quickbreads, and cookies, but some provide recipes for sandwiches or other savory dishes. Although the inclusive dates are 1869-2002, most publications date from the 1910s-1970s. In addition to numerous flour companies, including Robin Hood Flour Mills, Washburn Crosby Company, and King Arthur Flour, among others, this series includes publications from corporations that produced both flour and baking mixes, such as various iterations of the Pillsbury company.

did.unittitle: Box 8a.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Creators include:

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes. 23rd ed. 80 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Calumet Baking Powder. Includes color illustrations of woman in period dress, company child and dog mascots, company model kitchen and laboratories, facilities, product packaging, and serving suggestions; product quality guarantee; Modern Priscilla certificate of approval; offers for additional copies of publication and The children's party book; full page advertisements for product and for company-sponsored radio programs; descriptions of product composition and of the company's Home Economics Dept.; table of cooking times; table of ideal food combinations; table of weights and measures; method for testing freshness of product; household hints and table etiquette; recipes for baked goods, candies, soups, salads and entrees; and index. Sample recipes: cream puffs, Charlotte Russe, and Calumet meat pie.

did.unittitle: [Calumet recipe book]. 40 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes Calumet Baking Powder. Includes menus and recipes organized by event or theme such as Afternoon Tea or Lincoln's Birthday Party; novel serving ideas; illustrations of serving suggestions, table settings and people in period dress; and index. Sample recipes: chicken mousse, Washington pie, and roast goose. Damaged: covers missing, first and last pages loose.

did.unittitle: [Six Calumet Baking Powder recipe cards].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Calumet Baking Powder. Includes six quantity recipes for cookies, quick breads, and muffins; General Foods product list; and place to record costs on each card. Sample recipe: rich corn bread. Marked: 1068-39, 1068-46, 1068-50, 1068-51, 1068-59, and 1068-192.

did.unittitle: Good things to eat. 114th ed. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Arm & Hammer and Cow Brand Baking Sodas and features recipes tested and approved in the Arm & Hammer and Cow Brand Baking Soda Kitchen by Martha Lee Anderson. Includes introduction, comments on use of sour milk, buttermilk and baking soda; substitutes for sour milk and buttermilk; facts regarding plain white flour; baking and kitchen tips; tables of weights and measures, temperatures and baking times, and cooking times for vegetables; illustrations of product packaging and serving suggestions; recipes for hot breads, cakes, cookies, puddings and doughnuts, and frostings and sauces; and index. Sample recipes: bran muffins, golden spice cake, and Saturday's pudding. Marked: F-1000-1-36.

did.unittitle: Arm and Hammer book of valuable recipes. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Arm and Hammer baking soda. Includes introduction; comments on use of sour milk or buttermilk in place of baking powder; advantages of Arm and Hammer soda; general directions for cooking with baking soda; hints on baking; tables of weights and measures and weights per bushel of grain in 33 states; tips for using baking soda for cleaning and stain removal; what to do in case of accidents; postage rates; illustrations of people in period dress; recipes (some attributed) for soups, breads, cakes, cookies, candies, frostings, pastry, puddings, desserts, soups, and sauces; offer for additional copies; and index. Sample recipes: mock bisque soup, griddle cakes, and jelly roulade. Damaged: missing outside covers.

did.unittitle: Good things to eat. 118th ed. 15 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes Arm & Hammer and Cow Brand Baking Soda with introduction by Martha Lee Anderson of the Church & Dwight Co., Inc. Research Test Kitchen. Includes tips for using baking soda for cleaning, fire extinguishing and odor removal; illustrations of product packaging and serving suggestions; and recipes for cakes, frostings, cookies, and quick breads. Sample recipes: red devil's loaf cake, peanut butter icebox cookies, and lemon clover rolls. Marked: D-2000-3-37.

did.unittitle: Cow Brand Soda cook book and facts worth knowing. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Cow Brand Soda. Includes perpetual calendar; introduction to the housewife; full-page advertisement for Cow Brand Soda (or saleratus); advantages of Cow Brand Soda; use of soda with sour milk, buttermilk or cream of tartar; household tips; tips for estimating measures, measuring cubic contents of a corn crib, and capacities of square and circular cisterns; advice on using baking soda for various household tasks and for farm animals; postage rates and regulations; tables of weights and measures and weights of a bushel of grain in 34 states; how deep to plant corn and amount of barbed wire required for fence; daily savings at compound interest; illustrations of product packaging; recipes for breads, cakes, candies, desserts, puddings, pies, soups, and sauces; and index. Sample recipes: corn dodgers, Queen Ann apple flamri, and Everton taffy. Marked: (Cow).

did.unittitle: [Thirty promotional cards showing useful birds of America].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] promotes use of Arm & Hammer and Cow Brand Baking Sodas as a dentifrice and features commissioned illustrations of birds by Louis Agassiz Fuertes from the ninth and tenth series of "Useful birds of America". Includes common name, scientific name, and habitat information for each bird. No recipes. Each card numbered by series.

did.unittitle: Eighty years of baking powder history: 1859-1939. 23 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] is a history of the Rumford Chemical Works. Includes history of the company; biographies of founders Eben N. Horseford and George F. Wilson and of Benjamin Thompson, Count Rumford; illustrated descriptions of past and present company facilities and baking powder manufacturing techniques; and quotations from the works of Count Rumford. No recipes.

did.unittitle: 64 new uses for Rumford all-phosphate baking powder in daily cooking. 29 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10] promotes Rumford Baking Powder. Includes introduction about cooking with baking powder; advantages of Rumford all-phosphate baking powder; illustrations of product packaging, people in period dress and serving suggestions; recipes for vegetables, meat, fish, cheese, eggs, desserts, icings, and candy; and index. Sample recipes: tomato bisque, French meat sandwich, and lemon pie filling. Marked: K-104. I-31.

did.unittitle: [Rumford Baking Powder notebook]. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] promotes Rumford Baking Powder. Notebook with blank graph-paper pages and covers with advertisements for Rumford Baking Powder. Includes product packaging illustration. Marked: A.62. Damaged: covers loose.

did.unittitle: [Rumford Baking Powder cook book]. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12] promotes Rumford Baking Powder. Includes recipes compiled by Henrietta C. Beeks for biscuits, breads, muffins, cakes, cake icings and fillings, puddings, confectionary, and ice cream; table of weights and measures; tips on measuring; offer of "Rumford complete cook book" by Lily Haxworth Wallace for 10 cards from one-pound Rumford Baking Powder cans; advice on reading the label; and illustrations of child on front cover, Rumford factory, and product packaging. Sample recipes: steamed Boston brown bread, Rumford marigold cake, and cream tutti-frutti. Name handwritten on front cover. Marked: P-49.

did.unittitle: Clabber Girl baking book. 15 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [13] promotes Clabber Girl Baking Powder. Includes anonymous testimonials; comments on origin of baking; illustrated table of 7 vitamins and their sources; tips for perfect baking results; recipes for biscuits, muffins, quick breads, cakes, cookies, cake frostings, pastries, desserts, noodles, and dumplings; and illustrations of standard beef cuts, women in period dress, product packaging, and serving suggestions. Sample recipes: Clabber Girl biscuits, orange nut bread, and pumpkin chiffon pie.

did.unittitle: The cook's book. 47 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [14] promotes K C Baking Powder. Includes recipes, some by Janet McKenzie Hill, for self-rising flour, breads, cakes, muffins, biscuits, pancakes, puddings, desserts, and cookies; qualities of K C Baking Powder; facsimile of award given to company for service during First World War; product guarantee; tips on oven temperature regulation; tables of proportions and equivalent weights and measures; and illustrations of company laboratory, serving suggestions, and product packaging. Sample recipes: K C German coffee cake, K C berry puffs, and K C oatmeal macaroons.

did.unittitle: A lesson plan on the baking powder biscuit and its relatives (biscuits and pastries). Revised. 18 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [15], by Elsie Stark, director of Home economics dept., R.B. Davis Company, promotes Davis Baking Powder, Davis Dry Yeast Baking Powder, and Cocomalt. Includes classifications of batters and doughs; characteristics of the pastry group; method of mixing and essential ingredients of biscuit or pastry dough; descriptions off members of the pastry family; standard biscuit recipe; table showing relationship of certain pastry doughs; general directions for pastry; physics of pastry making; pie crust recipe; puff paste recipe; recipes for baking powder biscuits, pies, and vol-au-vents; and list of other booklets in the series. Sample recipes: bran biscuits, lemon pie, and chicken à la king vol-au-vents. Marked: A.

did.unittitle: A lesson plan on deep fat frying. Revised. 19 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [16], produced by R.B. Davis' Home economics dept., promotes Davis Baking Powder, Davis Dry Yeast Baking Powder, and Cocomalt. Includes table of smoking temperatures of common fats; classification of fats; list of equipment for deep fat frying; list of foods that may be cooked in deep fat; temperatures and time table for deep fat frying; recipes for doughnuts, crullers, fritters, and croquettes and list of other booklets in series. Sample recipes: vanilla and mace doughnuts, corn fritters, and potato balls. Marked: C.

did.unittitle: A lesson plan on baking powder batters and doughs. Revised. 10 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [17], produced by R.B. Davis' Home economics dept., promotes Davis Baking Powder, Davis Dry Yeast Baking Powder, and Cocomalt. Includes history of bread; notes on physics and chemistry of bread; definition of baking powder; general rules for making quick breads; general proportions for batters and doughs; recipes using batters and doughs; and list of other booklets in the series. Sample recipes: popovers, waffles, and shortcake. Marked: G.

did.unittitle: Cream Baking Powder pastry book. 24 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [18] promotes Cream Baking Powder. Includes testimonial from chief steward at Young's Hotel, Boston, Mass.; Cost comparison with Royal and Cleveland baking powders; recipes for biscuits, breads, rolls, cakes, frostings, gems, muffins, griddle cakes, waffles, pies, puddings, and pudding sauces; table of weights and measures; and product packaging illustration. Sample recipes: Vienna rolls, bride's cake, and Christmas pudding. Damaged: name of owner hand written on cover.

did.unittitle: Making biscuits : delicious recipes, biscuits, muffins, quick breads. 14 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [19] promotes Royal Baking Powder. Includes tips on making biscuits; recipes for biscuits, breads, and muffins; menus for Sunday night suppers; offer of "Royal cook book" (item [20]); and product packaging illustration. Sample recipes: Virginia biscuit, poppy muffins, and peanut butter bread.

did.unittitle: Box 8b.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Creators include:

did.unittitle: Royal cook book. 49 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [20] promotes Royal Baking Powder. Includes notes on superiority of cream of tartar baking powder; advice on measuring ingredients and baking; table of equivalent weights and measures; recipes for breads, rolls, griddle cakes, waffles, fritters, cakes, icings, puddings and other desserts, pastries, pies, soups, fish, meats, poultry, sauces, eggs, vegetables, beverages, and candy; advice on fireless cookery, cooking for an invalid, and preserving and canning; product packaging and serving suggestion illustrations; and index. Sample recipes: corn and rice pone, honey drop cakes, and stew with dumplings.

did.unittitle: Wabash Baking Powder Company. 19 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [21] promotes Wabash baking powder, corn starch, soda, and lemon extract, which can be given private labels. Addressed to grocers, includes illustrations of suggested individualized packaging with pricing for various sizes and quantities and factory illustration. No recipes.

did.unittitle: Winter menu magic. 24 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [22] promotes Uneeda Bakers crackers and cookies. Includes foreword by Nancy Best including offer to send copies of booklet; menus and recipes for variety of occasions; and index listing recipes under Uneeda product used in recipe. Sample recipes: baked meat croquettes, cranberry pie, and poularde Marie Antoinette.

did.unittitle: The trick of yeast rolls and coffee cakes. 13 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [23] promotes yeast cooking. Designed to accompany a film strip with the same title and narration guide, includes basic sweet yeast dough recipe, further recipes for rolls and cakes, and period dress illustration. Sample recipes: hot cross buns, orange rosette coffee cake, and Stollen.

did.unittitle: Easy drawing for little ones. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [24] promotes Fleischmann's Compressed Yeast. Includes illustrated poem about girl baking bread made with Fleischmann's yeast when her mother is out shopping. No recipes. Marked: no. 18. Damaged: covers and pages loose.

did.unittitle: Excellent recipes for baking with Fleischmann's Yeast. 52 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [25] promotes Fleischmann's Yeast. Includes suggestions for using Fleischmann's Yeast; general hints; recipes for breads, rolls, muffins, waffles, griddle cakes, and cakes; and cover illustration of girl in Dutch national costume. Sample recipes: milk bread, English muffins, and savarin. Form no. 481, D-E. 2 copies.

did.unittitle: Oven melodies using Maca, the new fast granular yeast. 17 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Tried and tested recipes using Maca, the new fast dry yeast. 17 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [27] promotes Maca Yeast. Similar content to that of item [26] but without stamp-related offers and with invitation to Maca Exhibit in Food Building at 1939 New York World's Fair.

did.unittitle: The art of making bread at home. 34 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [28] promotes Maca Yeast. Includes comments on ingredients and procedure used for bread making; illustrated step-by-step guide to making good bread; recipes for breads, cakes, rolls, and root beer; illustrations of Hannah L. Wessling of Home economics dept at Northwestern Yeast Co., serving suggestions, and product packaging; and index. Sample recipes: rye bread sponge method, easy graham bread, and devil's food cake.

did.unittitle: Betty Arnold recipes. 16 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [29] promotes Arnold's bread and cookies. Includes image of and foreword by Betty Arnold; menus for lunch, tea, cocktail, barbecue, supper, and snack time with recipes for selected items; history of company; illustrations of kitchen, product packaging, and serving suggestions; and index. Sample recipes: buttercup cases with creamed shrimp, curried lambburger, and orange sweet toast.

did.unittitle: Bread stuffing the year 'round. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [30] promotes bread stuffing. Includes tips on stuffings; recipes for poultry, meat, fish, and vegetable stuffings; and serving suggestion illustration. Stamped on back cover "Compliments of Schaible's Bakery, Easton, Pa.". Sample recipes: apple-raisin bread stuffing for duck, savory stuffed baked pork chops, and Danish stuffed cabbage.

did.unittitle: The fascinating story of the pretzel with "fun food" recipes. 11 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [31] promotes pretzels. Includes history of the pretzel; suggestions for serving pretzels around the clock; recipes for pretzel dippers, pretzel crumb pies, meat loaf, turkey stuffing, salads, and soup; and illustrations of 15th century pretzel bakery, coat of arms including pretzel, period dress, and serving suggestions. Sample recipes: Acapulco dip, pretzel-chocolate ice cream pie, and Pennsylvania pretzel soup.

did.unittitle: Serve a surprise! 16 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [32] promotes Sara Lee frozen baked goods. Includes history of Kitchens of Sara Lee; recipes for family fare, toys, dessert parties, and important occasions; list of categories of Sara Lee baked and frozen products; suggestions for serving Sara Lee products; and serving suggestion illustrations. Some recipes include liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: banana split cake, frosted toy house, and mocha rum torte.

did.unittitle: How to make the 10 best sandwiches of the year : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [33] promotes sandwiches. Includes 10 best sandwich recipes (attributed and illustrated) in the National Sandwich Idea Contest run jointly by the Wheat Flour Institute and the National Restaurant Association from submissions by those who work in restaurants. Sample recipes: banana ham nutwich and the pearadise crab. Marked: L-27.

did.unittitle: Pepperidge Farm, "the versatile stuffing". 27 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [34] promotes Pepperidge Farm stuffings for a variety of everyday and company occasions. Includes tips on using stuffing; recipes for stuffings; notes on stuffing turkey; illustrations of serving suggestions and product packaging; and index. Sample recipes: meat loaf Italiano, dill stuffed sea bass, and stuffed artichokes. Marked: 1805.

did.unittitle: Delicious dip recipes from Mr. Phipps Pretzel Chips. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [35] promotes Mr. Phipps Pretzel Chips. Includes dip recipes (suitable for cutting out as recipe cards); coupons for Mr. Phipps Pretzel Chips, Grey Poupon mustard, Ortega salsa or sauce, Egg Beaters, Fleischmann's Margarine, and American Classic crackers; serving suggestion and product packaging illustrations; and index. Sample recipes: country mustard dip, shrimp cocktail dip, and savory broccoli dip.

did.unittitle: "Better than home baked" : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Duncan Hines recipes & more. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [37] promotes Duncan Hines mixes for baked goods. Includes recipes for bake sales, fall tailgate party, soccer ball cake, and kids; advice on utensils for making desserts; recipes from readers; answers to baking questions from Gwen Brima, director of Duncan Hines Kitchen; Duncan Hines coupons; pull-out recipe cards; and serving suggestion and product packaging illustrations. Sample recipes: fancy walnut brownies, autumn gold pumpkin cake, and Thanksgiving cranberry cobbler. Damaged: coupons removed.

did.unittitle: Box 9.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Creators include:

list.item: Self-Rising Flour and Corn Meal Program, Inc.

did.unittitle: Swans Down prepared, not self-rising, cake flour : [leaflet].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Swans Down Cake Flour. Includes cake recipes, coupon for "Cake secrets" by Janet McKenzie Hill, advertisements for Swans Down Health Bran and Graham Flour, history of Swans Down, and product packaging and period dress illustrations. Sample recipes: marble cake and strawberry shortcake.

did.unittitle: Baking secrets. 35 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes Swans Down Cake Flour and Calumet Baking Powder. Includes tips for baking success; importance of using right ingredients; 7 recipe lessons; additional recipes; causes of baking problems; cake "score card"; and product packaging and serving suggestion illustrations. Sample recipes: devil's food cake, Swans Down muffins, and apple pandowdy.

did.unittitle: Fruit filled cream puffs : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Gold Medal flour, enriched in the interests of "public health in connection with the National Defense Program." Includes recipes, offer of free "bread leaflet", coupon for Betty Crocker "patriotic" party favors, testimonial from and illustration of Eleanor Howe; and serving suggestion illustrations. Sample recipes: buttercup cake and washboards.

did.unittitle: Gold Medal jubilee select recipes. 48 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Gold Medal flour on 75th anniversary of its winning Gold Medal at Miller's International Exhibition in Cincinnati, Ohio. Includes preface by Betty Crocker; history of Gold Medal flour; updated popular recipes from and highlights of events in each decade from 1880 to 1955; and factory, product packaging, serving suggestion, and period illustrations. Sample recipes: chocolate drop cookies, cheese souffle, and Haddon Hall gingerbread. Damaged: back cover missing.

did.unittitle: Betty Crocker's "frankly fancy" foods recipe book. 26 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Gold Medal flour. Includes preface by Betty Crocker; tips for different kinds of parties; food and beverage recipes; product packaging and serving suggestion illustrations; and index. Sample recipes: individual brioche, cheese cake, and almond oven-fried chicken. Marked: A 13377.

did.unittitle: [Betty Crocker book advertisements : folded brochures].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes "Betty Crocker's picture cook book." Includes list of book featureS; samples of recipe titles and "how-to" illustrations; illustrations of book cover, serving suggestions, and period dress; and order form for book purchase from the Fair bookstore. No recipes.

did.unittitle: Betty Crocker's Bisquick cook book. 26 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Bisquick. Includes 157 recipes; illustrations of product packaging and serving suggestions; and index. Sample recipes: deviled ham turnovers, salmon rabbit pie, and lemon coffee cake.

did.unittitle: Betty Crocker's holidays on parade. 23 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] is a magazine pull-out promoting Gold Medal flour, Fleishmann's yeast, Blue Bonnet margarine, and Peter Pan peanut butter. Includes preface by and illustration of Betty Crocker; recipes appropriate for 12 holidays throughout year; product packaging and serving suggestion illustrations; and store coupons. Sample recipes: New Year's bell cake, watermelon cookies, and Washington jubilee pie. Marked: A19174.

did.unittitle: Feeding all classes : [ trade card].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] promotes Pillsbury flour. Includes facsimile of circular found in sacks of Pillsbury flour and illustrations of period dress. No recipes. Damaged: half of item may be missing.

did.unittitle: Pillsbury recipes. 24 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10] promotes Pillsbury flour, oats, and Vitos. Includes recipes by Fannie Merritt Farmer, Isabel Howard Neff, Myra Russell Garrett, and others; product packaging illustrations; and advertisement for "The American pure food cook book and household economist." Sample recipes: oat food griddle cakes, peanut cookies, and Vitos gruel.

did.unittitle: Pillsbury's family of foods : [2 folded brochures].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] consists of nos. 21 and 22 of series of brochures promoting Pillsbury flours. Includes product packaging illustrations and recipes of which some are by Mary Ellis Ames. Sample reipes: Mary Ellis Ames' two-egg cake method, whole wheat prune bread, and ladies aid chocolate cake. Form nos. 3694A and 3695B.

did.unittitle: It's fun to try new recipes, when you're sure they'll turn out well : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12], no. 10 in series of brochures, promotes Pillsbury's Best Flour. Includes letter from Mary Ellis Ames, director of Pillsbury's cooking service; advertisements for radio programs "Cooking close-ups" and "Today's children"; order form for "Balanced recipes" by Mary Ellis Ames; recipes; and product packaging illustrations. Sample recipe: spiced angel food cake.

did.unittitle: New ideas with old family recipes from Pillsbury : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [13], designed to be inserted in loose-leaf folder, promotes Pillsbury's bread and cake mixes. Includes postscript by Ann Pillsbury; bread and cake recipes; and offer for loose-leaf binder to hold item. Sample recipes: date bran muffins, coconut streusel coffee cake, and nutmeg-glazed banana bread. Marked: 55-59-2.

did.unittitle: America's Bake-Off cookbook : 100 winning recipes from Bake-Off 27. 95 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [14], edited by Christine Fossum, promotes Pillsbury products. Includes Bake-Off 27 prize-winning recipes with name of winner; baking hints; how Bake-Off contest works, with illustrations; serving suggestion illustrations; advertisements for "The new Pillsbury family cookbook" and the 1977 Wilton yearbook; and index. Sample recipes: saucy fish and Cheddar bake, cheesy lasagne pizza, and super sour cream coffee cake.

did.unittitle: Pillsbury's Best Bread Flour cookbook. 16 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [15] promotes Pillsbury's Best Bread Flour. Includes bread recipes; product packaging and serving suggestion illustrations; and breadmaking tips. Sample recipes: pocket bread, caramel-nut sticky rolls, and cheese braids.

did.unittitle: America's Bake-Off contest free prize-winning recipes : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [16] promotes Pillsbury products. Includes 5 recipes. Sample recipe: ham and cheese biscuit pockets. Marked: 96-21-84A.

did.unittitle: The Fairies cook book. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [17] promotes Fisher's Blend Flour. Includes 183 recipes prepared under the direction of Isabelle Clark Swezy; poem lauding Fisher's Blend Flour; general bread-making directions; household hints; illustrations of fairies and factory on front cover and product packaging on back cover; offer of free copies of item; and index. Some recipes include liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: German peach cake, pop-overs, and baked carrot pudding.

did.unittitle: Recipes you'll like. [4] p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [18] promotes Daniel Webster Flour. Includes three recipes; illustrations of product packaging, serving suggestions, and period dress; and order form for "Daniel Webster cook book." Sample recipe: cheese straws.

Recipes annotated with changes needed for high altitudes. Sample recipes: apple pie, French coffee cake, and rice muffins. Loose leaflet insert promoting Kroger's Country Club Flour. did.unittitle: The Pillsbury cook book. 126 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes Pillsbury's Best Flour. Compiled by Nellie Duling Gans, who won Medal of Honor for perfect bread at St. Louis World's Fair. Includes household hints; tables of weights and measures, proportions, and cooking times; tables of contents of recipes and illustrations (sketches of cultivation and manufacture of flour, factory, and Minneapolis); information on yeast; coupons for cook book and pass for visiting the Pillsbury A Mill; and index. Some recipes include wine, beer, or liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: Vienna rolls, roast wild duck, and wine whey.

did.unittitle: Pillsbury's cook book. 96 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes Pillsbury's Best Flour. Completely revised version of items [2] and [3]. Includes company history; tables of cooking times, weights, and measures; Pillsbury mills, period dress, serving suggestion, and product packaging illustrations; information on preserving fruit and eggs from U.S. Dept. of Agriculture bulletins, and on yeast; blank pages for adding recipes; and index. Sample recipes: broiled quail, maple frango, and crullers.

did.unittitle: Pillsbury's cook book. 78 p.

did.unittitle: Leavening Agents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 2: Leavening Agents includes materials promoting yeast, baking powder, and sodium bicarbonate (baking soda). Publications date from 1879-1995. Those focused on yeast primarily date from 1920s-1930s and after 1970. Some notable corporate authors include Fleischmann & Co., Red Star Yeast and Products Company, National Yeast Co., Northwestern Yeast Company, and Golden Gate Compressed Yeast Company.

There is stronger late-19th and early-20th century representation among those focused on baking powder, with most publications dating from the 1890s-1940s. Some notable corporate authors include Calumet Baking Powder Company, Cleveland Baking Powder Company, Davis Baking Powder Company, Pure Baking Powder Co., Royal Baking Powder Company, Rumford Baking Powder Col, and Warner Baking Powder Company.

Baking soda (sodium bicarbonate) is less-well represented, but notable publications include numerous titles from the 1900s-1930s promoting Arm & Hammer baking soda, including editions of Arm & Hammer Soda Book of Valuable Recipes, Friend in Need: Facts Worth Knowing about Arm & Hammer Baking Soda as a Proven Medicinal Agent, and Good Things to Eat Made with Arm & Hammer.

scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Dwight's Cow Brand Baking Soda. Medical endorsement of bicarbonate of soda. Includes product packaging illustration and quote from physician asserting that, in 1918 and 1919, doses of Cow Brand Bicarbonate of Soda provided protection against the 'flu'.

did.unittitle: Successful baking for flavor and texture / by Martha Lee Anderson. 7th ed. 38 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Arm & Hammer Brand and Cow Brand Baking Soda. Includes serving suggestion and product packaging illustrations; introduction by Martha Lee Anderson; baking, kitchen, and vegetable cooking hints; and index. Sample recipes: favorite spice cake, maple cream frosting, and apple fritters. Marked: F-500-10-38.

did.unittitle: Selected recipes : how to make the finest bread and the most delicious rolls, cakes, etc., by the use of Fleischmann & Co.'s compressed yeast : [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Fleischmann's Compressed Yeast. Includes baking hints, how to preserve yeast, and logo illustration. Sample recipes: waffles, white bread, and buckwheat cakes. Form 481. A.

did.unittitle: Delightful breads and buns and coffee cakes. 50 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes Fleischmann's compressed yeast. Includes baking hints; pictures of adults and children in period dress for various occasions, including masquerade, elegant dinners, and tea, often with elaborately table settings; and attributed testimonials on health benefits of eating yeast. Sample recipes: tea rolls, English bath buns, corn meal muffins, savarins, and streusel topping.

did.unittitle: Fleischmann's pure compressed yeast : the standard of excellence for over a quarter of a century. [4] p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Fleischmann's Compressed Yeast. Includes short history, warning against imitations, and yellow label illustration. Form No. 6 A.

did.unittitle: Fleishmann's booklet devoted to the interests of good baking and containing some valuable hints pertaining thereto. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] promotes Fleischmann's compressed yeast. Includes baking hints, short history, label illustration, and measuring hints. Form no. 481 B.

did.unittitle: The basic sweet dough formula : a labor-saving development in the sweet goods market. 10th ed. 47 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] is a cookbook for bakers from Standard Brands and Fleischmann's Yeast Service. Includes market data on bakeries' percentage of bread making; scalable basic sweet dough formula; baking hints; technique and serving suggestion illustrations; recipes for wide variety of baked goods; and marketing and sales promotion hints. Two-hole punched. Fleischmann's yeast packaging illustration and NRA label on back cover.

did.unittitle: The Fleischmann treasury of yeast baking. 51 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10] promotes Fleischmann's yeast, margarine, and other Standard Brand products. Includes serving suggestion and product packaging illustrations; letter from Mary Lynn Woods; ingredient, utensil, and yeast baking hints with technique illustrations; chapter on foreign breads and rolls; and index. Sample recipes: apple crumb coffee cake, French bread, pecan sticky buns, and spiral roll.

did.unittitle: Bake at home using Magic Yeast. 12 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] promotes Magic Yeast. Includes illustrated baking hints; recipe for ferment using potatoes and yeast; time required for 4 1-lb loaves (3 hrs 22 minutes); illustrated premiums for Magic Yeast wrappers (Community silverware and semi-porcelain dinner ware); and serving suggestion, product packaging, and period dress (front cover) illustrations. Sample recipes: rye bread, and Parker House rolls. In plastic protector.

did.unittitle: The art of making bread. 29 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12] promotes Yeast Foam and Magic Yeast. Includes four methods of bread- baking, including Speed-Bake; extensive illustrated baking hints and ingredient information; serving suggestion and product packaging illustrations; and index. Sample recipes: apple cake rose form and clover leaf rolls.

did.unittitle: Old fashioned California sourdough starter : [brochure]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [13], distributed by Allied General Industries, gives history and recipe for sourdough starter. Illustration of camp and flap-jack making on cover. Sample recipes: sourdough flap-jacks and sourdough French bread.

did.unittitle: Livre de cuisine "Magic" et guide des menagères. 73 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [14] promotes Magic Baking Powder. In French with some English recipe titles and product names. Product packaging and factory (inside back cover) illustrations. Cover detached.

did.unittitle: Box 39

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Creators include:

did.unittitle: The Crystal cook book : published in the interest of pure food / by Alice Priest Ewell. 127 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Crystal Baking Powder, notably not containing alum. Includes recipes for soups, fish, meat, poultry and game, vegetables, salads, eggs, cheese and rice, desserts, pies, breads, cakes and candy; invalid diet; and household economy hints. Some recipes include wine or liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: eggs in ambush and apple slump.

did.unittitle: Practical baking lessons / Nevada Briggs. [10] p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes K.C. Baking Powder. Collection of reprinted newspaper columns by Nevada Briggs, published on 10 consecutive Thursdays, with practical baking lessons on selected topics (including muffins; short cakes and apple dumplings; paper bag cookery; and fritters and doughnuts).

did.unittitle: Dr. Oetker's recipes. 62, [8] p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Dr. Oetker's Backin (baking powder) and other products. Includes serving suggestion and factory illustrations (inside covers), baking hints, and Kitchen Wonder stove advertisement. Some recipes include wine as an ingredient. Sample recipes: almond and honey cake, punch rings, and potato balls.

did.unittitle: Dr. Oetker's Bild-Rezeptkarten von 1908 : [boxed recipe cards].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4], in German, promotes Dr. Oetker's Backpulver (baking powder). Recipe cards for cakes for special family occasions (father's birthday, picnic, and wedding) with charming colored illustrations showing period dress and cake.

did.unittitle: The hand and cornucopia. 8th ed. 79 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Dr. Price products: cream baking powder and extracts of lemon, vanilla, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Includes illustrations of factory and of workers in France (front cover), Sicily, and Mexico gathering materials for the extracts; testimonials from US Government Chemist and university chemists; and index. Sample recipes: marble cake, whortleberry cake, and Dr. Price's dyspeptic muffins.

did.unittitle: Thepure cook book / arranged and compiled by Gesine Lemcke. 124, [4] p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes Thepure Baking Powder and Keck's Gelatine. Recipes arranged and compiled by Gesine Lemcke, principal, Greater New York Cooking School. Includes food for the sick; household hints; 2 p. each of useful recipes in German (in Fraktur script) and French; Wholesale Grocers' National Association testimonial; product packaging illustrations; and index. Some recipes include wine as an ingredient. Sample recipes: turent cake, orange Bavarian cream, and oyster pie. 2 copies.

did.unittitle: A guide to Royal success in baking. 21 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Royal Baking Powder. Includes cover illustration of period kitchen with 3 women admiring baked cake; chemistry of baking powder; details of cake ingredients and steps in baking; how to judge and score cakes; index; and free offer for Royal cook book. Sample recipes: chocolate layer cake, Spanish cake, and seven-minute frostings. Marked: R1-42.

did.unittitle: Ryzon baking book / compiled and edited by Marion Harris Neil. 80 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] promotes Ryzon Baking Powder. Includes master recipes by 10 women listed on title page; 24 prize recipes from 8,379 recipes submitted; and illustrations of serving suggestions, product packaging, famous New York hotels using Ryzon Baking Powder (inside front cover), and Ryzon factory (inside back cover). Some recipes include liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: popovers, buttermilk waffles, and savory cheese pudding. Hard cover.

did.unittitle: Sea Foam's collection of dainty receipts. 28 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] promotes Sea Foam Baking Powder, pure grape cream tartar powder. Charming cover illustration of mermaid rising from the sea holding the product. Each recipe "contributed by some lady, from her own private collection." Recipe for Lady Baltimore cake, from which Owen Wister took the name for his novel "Lady Baltimore," featured. Includes some regional (mostly Southern) recipes and product packaging illustration. Some recipes include liquor as an ingredient. Notes Sea Foam Baking Powder is not made by the Trust, and "no Trust methods or Trust prices." Sample recipes: Mrs. T's plain cake and Philadelphia whims.

did.unittitle: Snow King Baking Powder : better baking recipes. 42 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10], a "real Southern cook book," promotes Snow King Baking Powder. Includes serving suggestion illustrations, household hints and tips for successful baking, and history of Snow King Baking Powder founded by Andrew Jackson Parlin (back cover). Sample recipes: apple flip-flop, leopard cookies, and cold-water cake. No company name given. Middle 4 pages loose.

did.unittitle: The Snow Flake cook book / contributed by C.R. Groff. 100 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] promotes Snow Flake Baking Powder and is contributed by C.R. Groff "to the ladies using" this powder. Includes offer of $1,000 reward if any terra alba, alum carbonate of ammonia, or deleterious adulteration can be found in a can of Snow Flake; tests comparing various baking powder brands; testimonials; and 30 pages of household hints with advice on setting tables, timetables for the cook and chambermaid, management of domestics, and directions for tea, dinner, and evening parties. Sample recipes: fried woodcock, apple puffs, and suet pudding.

did.unittitle: Baking powder in action, 2nd ed. 39 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12] promotes Calumet Baking Powder. Includes few recipes (1-egg cake, gold cake, and tea muffins); detailed information on types of baking powder; illustrated effects of varying amounts of baking powder, of varying temperatures, and of length of storage of cake batters; and selected bibliography.

did.unittitle: Box 40.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Creators include:
Related information; one sheet with Calumet history and one partial sheet with descriptions used for appraisal.

did.unittitle: Calumet cook book : reliable recipes. 64 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] contains a certificate that the product meets state and the US Pure Food Law of 1906. Includes general hints and directions for measuring and using baking powder. Several pages compare Calumet to Trust baking powders. Trust brands identified as Royal, Dr. Price's, and Cleveland's. Wine sauce and brandy sauce contain wine or liquor as ingredients. Some recipes are attributed and dated. Chapter on fireless cookers. Contains invoice to show Royal paying to have news articles placed.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes and helpful hints. 72 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] continues the debate over baking powder ingredients. Recipes use butter or lard as shortening for biscuits. Illustrations of factory, manufacturing process, Mrs. W.E. Farley "Kentucky's most famous cake and pastry maker", and Maude Marie Costello, "One of America's foremost authorities on scientific cooking and pure foods." Recipes similar to [1], without wine and brandy sauces. Suggested meal combinations in table format. Includes reasons for including dried egg whites in the product.

did.unittitle: The home of Calumet Baking Powder. 28 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] has a portrait of W.M. Wright, president and founder. Price of product is 35 cents per pound. Illustrations of "Calumet Kid", offices (with some employees identified), laboratories, manufacturing operations and advertisements. Appears to be sales aid for retailers. Some background for the book "Twenty Lessons in Domestic Science" by Marion Cole Fisher.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes and helpful hints. 72 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] is a smaller size version of [2]. It includes seasonal menu suggestions. Has offer for "Twenty Lessons in Domestic Science" book. Has portrait of Marion Cole Fisher.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes and helpful hints. 75 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] mentions Calumet Baking Schools. It has part of a monograph by Claudia Quigley Murphy.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes and helpful hints. 10th ed. 76 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] is similar to [5].

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes. 32 p. (2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] has a discussion of advantages of double acting baking powder. Biscuit recipes call for shortening.

did.unittitle: A lesson on waffles and griddle cakes / prepared by Helen Harrington Downing. 20 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] is illustrated with period equipment and serving pieces. Discussion of flour and leavening agents. Has a list of questions and includes references (p. 16). One of a series of seven monographs prepared for teachers and students by Calumet Baking Powder Company.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes. 16th ed. 82 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] contains an advertisement for "Children's Party Book" - available for one slip from the product package plus five 2 cent stamps. Has discussion of setting a table and serving the meal. Color illustrations of serving suggestions are provided. Factory illustrations include the material plant in Joliet, Illinois.

did.unittitle: A monograph on muffins / prepared by Helen Harrington Downing. 24 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10] is part of the series with [8], and is similar in style. This copy only lists two items in the series.

did.unittitle: The Calumet baking book : 89 recipes sure to succeed. 32 p. (2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] has recipes for chocolate Indians and stone jar molasses cookies. Some recipes call for Swans Down Cake Flour as an ingredient. One copy has a hole in the left corner.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes. 28th. ed. 84 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12] cover title is Calumet cook book : the key to better baking. Includes holiday menu suggestions. Advertisement for radio shows on WQJ in Chicago.

scopecontent.p: Item [13] has demonstration of double action of product. No illustration of factory or discussion of pure food laws. Now a part of General Foods Corporation.

did.unittitle: The Calumet book of oven triumphs! 32 p. (2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [17] is similar to item [2] except it uses illustrations of finished products on the covers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [18] includes free coupon for "Calumet Book of Oven Triumphs."

did.unittitle: Baking secrets. 36 p.

Recipe for Confederate cake. Some recipes use wine or liquor as an ingredient. Has menu from New York Herald for Christmas day. Discussion of purity of baking powders. Author noted as late chef de cuisine of New York Cooking School. Back cover missing.

scopecontent.p: Item [4] is similar to item [1] in style, with major revisions in content. No recipes for wild game or Confederate cake.

scopecontent.p: Item [5] is similar in style to item [1] with revisions in content. Has listing of cakes and cookies made with four eggs or less. Discussion of other baking powder ingredients versus cream of tartar laid in.

scopecontent.p: Item [6] is similar to [5] with unique cover art. Includes glossary of terms used in cookery. Laid in sheet similar to that in item [5], except larger size. Back cover notes: Compliments of the Housewives League.

did.unittitle: 55 ways to save eggs. 22 p.

scopecontent.p: Item [7] notes the present high price of eggs and provides comparison recipes with high and low egg content. Low egg recipes also replace butter with shortening. Has offer for free copy of Royal baker and pastry cook book.

did.unittitle: New Royal cook book. 50 p. (2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] is a new format. Includes section on fireless cooking, with recipes. Some recipes include wine as an ingredient.

scopecontent.p: Item [9] adds that Royal Baking Powder is double acting. Includes suggested menus.

scopecontent.p: Item [11] indicates that Royal Baking Powder is now part of Standard Brands, Inc. Format is similar to item [10], with revised content. Recipe for mince pie in [10] included making mince meat from scratch; this book only has baking directions. Newburg recipe calls for cooking sherry in place of sherry used in earlier editions. Has sample menus.

did.unittitle: Royal cook book. 45 p.

scopecontent.p: Item [12] has the same cover as [11], but inside cover now has advertisements for other Standard Brand products. Claims that the cookbook has been published since 1878. Contents revised from earlier editions. Includes discussion of ingredients for baking. Recipes call for sherry flavor or cooking sherry. Includes mailing envelope with NRA seal.

did.unittitle: A guide to royal success in baking. 22 p

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [13] states that Royal Baking Powder was introduced in 1866. Includes history of baking soda, baking powder, and cream of tartar. Chemical equations provided for cream of tartar baking soda. Inside cover quote "Today, with modern scientific bakeries in every community ... there is little necessity for the housewife to spend time on baking." Has judging and scoring standards for cakes. Detailed description of each step for butter cake.

did.unittitle: 24 easy baking recipes your family will rave about made with new Royal S.A.S. phosphate baking powder. 16 p.

did.unittitle: The Crystal cook book : published in the interest of pure food / by Alice Priest Ewell. 127 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes "the pure food Crystal Baking Powder"; made with acid phosphate of soda. Has description of differences between other types of baking powder. Many recipes do not use baking powder as an ingredient. Theory of soup selection and economic value. Some recipes include wine or liquor as an ingredient. Invalid diet and household hints sections. Prices listed on inside back cover.

did.unittitle: The cook's book. 63 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes K.C. Baking Powder, made from two unnamed acids (double acting). Recipes attributed to well known cooking experts (unnamed). Guaranteed to meet the food laws, both state and Federal. Illustrations of the products and factory. Some recipes include wine or liquor as an ingredient.

did.unittitle: The cook's book. 63 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] is similar to item [2] with fewer illustrations. Includes a recipe to make your own self-rising flour. Recipes are attributed to Mrs. Janet McKenzie Hill, editor "American cookery," but are similar to those in item [2]. Some recipes include wine as an ingredient.

did.unittitle: Tempting Davis recipes. 20 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Davis Baking Powder; a double acting product. Includes general rules for making quick breads. It has recipes for pumpkin pie and squash pie. Three pages of recipes for candy. Statement that every ingredient in their product is officially approved by U. S. food authorities. Indicates 47th year of production. Cover illustration is of period dress.

did.unittitle: The Calumet baking book. New ed. 31 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Calumet Baking Powder. Has a description of a test for double action in baking powder. Introduction by Marion Jane Parker. Cake recipe titles include number of eggs used.

did.unittitle: A collation of cakes : yesterday and today / by Claudia Quigley Murphy. 31 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] comes "through the courtesy of The Royal Baking Powder Co." for class rooms, women's clubs, etc. Includes bibliography. Historical recipes for cake and history of baking powder. Includes use of wine and liquor for flavor. Comments on benefits of cream of tartar based baking powder (like Royal) and problems with other types.

did.unittitle: A lesson plan on Christmas suggestions / by Ruth Leone Rutledge. 18 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Davis Baking Powder and "was prepared for teachers, demonstrators, and students of food and cookery." Cover inscribed: Nora Hughes. Has recipes for baked goods, candies, and salads. Poem: Now is the time of Christmas.

did.unittitle: The little book of excellent recipes / by the mystery chef. 103 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] promotes Davis Baking Powder. Scotch scone recipe gives direction for cooking on a griddle or in the oven. Beverages are made with Cocomalt. Includes household hints section. Seal of acceptance by the American Medical Assn. One chapter on national dishes of foreign countries. Includes main and side dish recipes as well as baked goods.

did.unittitle: Dwight's Cow Brand cook book. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Dwight's Cow Brand soda "or salaterus" as the "first, best, cheapest" for baking, bathing, cleaning, and medicinal purposes. Produced for domestic use since "forty eight years ago." Favors sour milk to provide acid, stating that cream of tartar, if impure, will turn baked goods yellow. Includes 17 recipes taken from 1882 publications, namely Common sense and Book of forty puddings compiled by Marion Harland; household hints and remedies using Cow Brand soda; general information for farmers; recipes for sunshine cake, steam corn bread, suet pudding, and preserving eggs; measure and weight equivalents, e.g., Troy weight and surveryor's measure; methods of estimating quantities, e.g., how to measure corn in a crib, hay in a meadow, capacity of cisterns, depth to plant corn, and amount of barbed wire required for fences; list of interesting facts; formula for telling a girl's age; postage rates; compound interest for daily savings; and 3-year calendar on inside front cover. Illustration of gold foil packaging on front and back covers. Inside pages detached.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Arm & Hammer soda for baking, bathing, cleaning, and medicinal purposes. Some contents similar to [1] and [2]. Cautions "Do not buy baking powder" in response to baking powder manufacturers saying "Do not use cream tartar and soda." Asserts that sour milk or buttermilk provides acid most economically, safely, and with best results. Illustrations of children in period dress. Includes household hints, including baking soda for extinguishing fires; solicitation of recipes from housewives; recipe for rendering lard; weights and measures; table of state requirements for number of pounds per bushel; postage rates noting war tax of 2 cents per money order; and help in case of accidents, e.g., drowning, lightening, and tests for death. Perpetual calendar on inside front cover. Offer for free additional copies on p. 2. Product packaging illustration on back cover.

did.unittitle: Arm & Hammer soda book of valuable recipes. 46th ed. 32 p

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Arm & Hammer soda for baking, bathing, cleaning, and medicinal purposes. Some contents similar to [1]-[3] with format and illustration differences. Includes humorous illustrations and directions for using baking soda for medicinal purposes and bathing. Offer on p. 30 of lithograph card, one of 30 designs, included in each package. Product packaging illustration on back cover.

did.unittitle: Arm & Hammer soda book of valuable recipes & useful information. 47th ed. 1 v. (unpaged)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Includes poetic dedication to housewives in style of Longfellow on first page; list of birthday stones and wedding anniversary gifts on last page; and suggestions for using baking soda in cooking meats and vegetables. Product packaging illustration on back cover. Guaranteed under Food and Drug Act.

did.unittitle: Arm & Hammer soda book of valuable recipes. 53rd ed. 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Includes section on "A woman's business" on p. 2, stating that, though some women have pursuits outside the home, for most, their career is homemaking; section on "How to be popular" through successful baking and homemaking on p. 3; suggestions for using leftovers; expanded information on cooking meats and vegetables; economical and varied menus; and cooking time tables. Product packaging illustration on back cover. No Food and Drug Act note.

did.unittitle: Arm & Hammer soda book of valuable recipes. 72nd ed. 32 p.

Product packaging illustration on back cover.

did.unittitle: A friend in need : facts worth knowing about Arm & Hammer baking soda as a proven medicinal agent. 28 p. (1924)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] promotes Arm & Hammer soda for medicinal purposes. Foreword dedicates booklet to medical profession and includes letter attributed to Dr. Edward R. Hays promoting baking soda as a household remedy. References to pharmacology and medical texts, for example, Materia medica: pharmacology and therapeutics, Practical therapeutics, Treatment of internal diseases, and extract from paper by Dr. Leonard Keene Hirshberg, John Hopkins University. "It more than fulfills the requirements of U.S. Pharmacopoeia" --inside back cover. Illustration of 10 oz. glass jar for medicine cabinet on p. 28. Product packaging illustration on back cover.

did.unittitle: The Crystal cook book / by Alice Priest Ewell. 127 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Crystal Baking Powder as being a "pure food" superior to other baking powders, especially those containing alum. Includes cooking hints; invalid diet; information on types of baking soda; household economy hints; and illustrations of woman in period dress (cover) and product packaging. Sample recipes: rabbit pie, cherry puffs, and rice gems.

did.unittitle: Worth reading : cakes without eggs. 16 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] promotes Crescent Baking Soda as superior to baking powders containing cream-of-tartar, known to cause stomach, kidney, and intestinal disorders. Recipes use baking powder as leavening agent instead of eggs. Includes $500 reward for evidence of injury from using Crescent Baking Powder and illustration of woman in period dress (front cover). Sample recipes: ginger snaps, eggless fruit cake, and cinnamon buns.

did.unittitle: Reliable recipes, 16th ed. 80 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Calumet Baking Powder and supports "alum" in baking powder, citing experts and rebuking Royal Baking Powder's claim to the contrary. Includes illustrations of Chicago plant, laboratories, hospital room for Calumet employees, and product packaging; testimonials from Marian Cole Fisher, noted baking expert and teacher at St. Paul and Mrs. W. E. Farley, 20-time blue ribbon winner, Kentucky State fair; endorsements of housewives bureau and Modern Priscilla Magazine; cooking, household, and cleaning hints; offer for a free children's party book, and index. Sample recipes: custard pie, boiled salad dressing, egg frosting, and Calumet cream puffs. Covers torn and detatched.

did.unittitle: Cook book, useful information, and interesting data. 64 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] promotes Davis Baking Powder as superior to brands of baking powder containing cream of tartar. Includes physicians' statements that cream of tartar and soda produce potash salts (poisonous) and that Davis Baking Powder is "healthful." Includes illustrations of Davis manufacturing plant and product packaging; household hints; medical information; comparison of outdated notions with modern and scientific views; measures and weights; and numerous jokes from The foolish dictionary. Sample recipes: Jenny Lind cake, baked pudding, and mutton ragout.

did.unittitle: Davis Baking Powder cook book : useful information and interesting data. 62 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Some recipes include liquor. Sample recipes: oyster sauce, dish of macaroni, and green corn patties.

list.item: Dr. Price's cream baking powder company.

did.unittitle: Rumford almanac and cookbook. 36 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [1] promotes Rumford Yeast Powder. Almanac and cookbook. Includes moons' phases and sun rises sun sets calendar. Testimonials on the efficacy of Rumford Yeast Powder in treating nervous affections, dyspepsia, bilious diseases. Cover illustrated with turkey hiding from farmers ax. Some recipes use wine or liquor as an ingredient. Sample recipes: Corn cakes, Biscuit for dyspeptics, and Rumford Johnny cake.

did.unittitle: Rumford alamanc and cookbook. 36 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [2] similar to item [1]. promotes Rumford Yeast Power. Expert testimony from physicians in using baking powder to treat dyspepsia, morning sickness, intemperance, seasickness. . Cover illustration of young girl holding a locket. Other illustrations include children on a picnic, mice stealing fresh baked pies and cookies, children baking birthday cake. Some recipes use liquor as an ingredient . Sample recipes: Rice buns, Custard pie, Angel cake.

did.unittitle: Star crystal cookbook. 131 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [3] promotes Star Crystal Baking Powder. Provides a table of equivalents and table of proportions. Blank pages for additional recipes. Several newspaper recipes pasted inside. No illustrations. Includes hints on cake making. Some recipes use wine, beer, or liquor as an ingredient. Variety of recipes for breads, cakes, pastries, soup, fish, entrees. item is very fragile.

did.unittitle: Baxter's receipt book : practical up to date for bakers. 100 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [4] Richard Baxter's cookbook for bakers. Inscription states that the recipes are the fruit of many years' experience as a baker. Laid inside is a type written letter from E.B. Gallagher and Company that discusses a formula for fried cakes. Illustration of Richard Baxter with signature. Blank pages for notes. Variety of recipes for cakes, sweets and rolls, cookies. Sample recipes: Lemon cookies, English muffins, Puff-paste.

did.unittitle: Extracts from a treatise on the character of baking powders, etc. 8 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [5] promotes Rumford Baking Powder. An eight page treatise on the constituents of baking powder; phosphates, tartrates, sodium sulphate. No recipes.

did.unittitle: Royal baker and pastry cook : a manual of practical receipts for home baking and cooking. 43 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [6] promotes Royal Baking Powder. Laid inside is a explanation on the three different kinds of baking powders on the market. Provides a four page warning against using alum baking powders with expert testimony from chemists, physicians, and hygienist. Hints on baking and cake making. Exhibitable cover illustration of mother and daughter baking a cake and rolls. Some recipes use wine or liquor as an ingredient. Variety of recipes for cakes, pies, dumplings, puddings, sauces, meats, poultry, fish. Sample recipes: German apple cake, Spice cake, Minnehaha cake.

did.unittitle: Table and kitchen : a compilation of approved cooking receipts. 57 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [7] promotes Dr Rice's Cream Baking Powder. Provides directions on proper storage of baking powder. Facts worth knowing on the three different kinds of baking powder; tartar, phosphate, alum. Expert testimony from Prof. Vaughan, University of Michigan, on the negative qualities of baking power made with alum. The back cover contains a warning against canvassers from the Alum Baking Powder making misleading claims. Variety of recipes for griddle cakes, breads, fish, soups, meats and poultry, vegetables, puddings, cakes, pies. Sample recipes: Saratoga chips, Bachelors pudding, Brandied peaches.

did.unittitle: Swan downs flour. [folded brochure]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [8] promotes Swans Down Cake Flour. Illustrations of a variety of cookies and cakes. All recipes use Swans Down cake flour. Sample recipes: Banana nut cake, Butterscotch cookies, Cheese straws.

did.unittitle: Book of breads. 12 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [9] promotes Cooperative grange league federation exchange. Recipes by Lucile Brewer of Cornell University. Inside cover contains a foreword by H.E. Babcock, General Manager. Hints at making good bread. Variety of recipes for bread making, puddings, cakes, cookies. Sample recipes: Clover leaf rolls, Caramel rolls, Whole wheat spice cakes.

did.unittitle: Gold medal kitchen guide : recipes-short cuts-household hints. 255 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [10] promotes Mountain City Hill Flour. Kitchen hints on washing greasy dishes, keeping yolks fresh, left over vegetables. Household hints on painting house, washing windows, gas stove burner care. Blank pages for additional recipes. Variety of recipes for fish, eggs and omelets, salads, breads, meats and sauces, vegetables, cakes, pies, sandwiches. Sample recipes: Cream of lima bean, Baked hash, Sandwich fillings.

did.unittitle: Quick frozen fruits and vegetables. [folded brochure].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [11] promotes Polar Brand Frozen Foods. Provides five reasons to purchase Polar brand frozen foods; consumer demands, easy to handle, no waste, no spoilage, sales boosters. List of Polar Brand fruits available and Polar Brand vegetables available. Illustrations include Polar Brand dealer selling woman frozen peas, woman storing vegetables in freezer, woman pouring frozen vegetables into boiling water. No recipes.

did.unittitle: Good things to eat : henkel's extra fancy flours. 64 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [12] promotes Henkel's Extra Fancy Flour. Provides a table of equivalents for teaspoon, tablespoon, cup, ounce, pound, gill, pint, quart, gallon. Foreword states that the recipes in the book have been both kitchen and laboratory tested. Cover illustration shows a frontier home with a woman baking at a table. Some recipes use wine or liquor as an ingredient. Variety of recipes for cakes, frostings, cookies, pies, muffins. Sample recipes: Yellow angel food cake, Mahogany cake, Peach dumplings.

did.unittitle: Dreikorn's orange wrap bread : what kind of party shall I give? 32 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [13] promotes Dreikorn's Orange Wrap Bread. Provides the hostess with unusual ideas for her next party. Party themes include bridge party, amateur night party, aviation party, circus party. Three pages are devoted to how to tell fortunes. Cover illustration is of a 1940s hostess asking herself "what kind of a party shall I give"? Sample recipes: Moscow canapés, Boston bean sandwich, Creole dried beef.

did.unittitle: Celia Lee's centennial baking book. 63 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [14] promotes Centennial Flour. Foreword by Celia Lee, Director for Home Economics Department. Provides general information on flour, leavening agents, shortening, measuring, altitude for baking, yeast making. Photographs of breads, waffles, cookies, cakes. "MS recipe for cookies on back cover." Sample recipes: Brownie bars, Banana nut cake, Standard pancakes.

did.unittitle: Specialty breads. 144 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Item [15] promotes General Mills flour. Provides advice to business owners on the promotion of specialty breads in stores. Statistical data on bread consumption, sales promotion, window displays, budgeting. Background on bread through the ages beginning with prehistoric times and encompassing Egypt, Rome, and its role in the "average American diet." Variety of recipes for fruit breads, rye breads, quick breads, rolls, doughnuts. Sample recipes: Sesame egg twist bread, Fig bread, Orange bread.
